Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anissia10
Reviews.Content: Meddusa hotel is a good hotel, with good location, next the main monument (topkapi, hagyasofia, and blue mosque) the tram is just near in sultanahmet avenue. The breakfast is good with coffee milk, tea, cheese, eggs, butter, varied the rooms are small but clean also the bathroom, ideal for the tourist with small budget

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst nights of my life...”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: It was like something out of a film. Luckily we only had to spend a night there after a mix up with booking our original hotel (The Modern Sultan, much, much better) The room is a joke, measures about 2 meters by 3 metres, with dilapidated furniture and a general grubby appearance. And the bathroom? It was so small I could sit on the toilet, brush my teeth in the sink and have a shower ALL AT THE SAME TIME!! It was very noisy, with a main street right outside the building, so plenty of traffic. We could clearly hear people stomping around the hotel until the early ours of the morning. And the lift? Enough room for one person, and no door to the cubicle, so you're seeing bare stone pass 2 inches from your nose. On the plus side, the terrace was nice.

Reviews.Title: “best catch for the price / budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Russell J
Reviews.Content: it was a good location and easy access to all attractions and walking distance from old city of istanbul & easy access also to the local tram. Room was nice and clean and the staff were very friendly and generous,.. they spoke english which was really helpful and a relief.. after a bad experience @ the airport. I would like to recommend this hotel to budget travellers especially after the new management took over as I was informed by Mr. Eser Akkoc.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: Tammi M
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Istanbul. It's a beautiful city.. we had so much fun. The hotel was in a great location, amazing view to the city and it was so easy to go anywhere from there. People are so friendly and they offered the best service. Also it came to my attention that the staff were communicating in English with westerns, which made us comfortable to ask for any assistance. I highly recommend tourists to book in Meddusa Hotel. you wont regret it :) Special thanks to Mr. Eser Akkoc and his new management team who have been a great help to us. We will definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: jlaroche
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and fled. We arrived on a late flight into Istanbul and arrived at the hotel after midnight and extremely tired. The staff was friendly but the room was hell. Instead of a window, we for nd a large steel firedoor behind a curtain. The toilet wasn't bolted down to the floor, so the seal didn't hold and dirty water would run out onto the bath room floor whenever we flushed. The drain in the all-in-one shower didn't work well so the water level would quickly rise over the half centimeter door sill and flow into the bedroom. Had we not been so tired,we would have checked out immediately, but hung on for a night. As soon as the sun rose I ran to the Erboy hotel and secured a new room there.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: Sam K
Reviews.Content: Eventough I asked for a non smoking room when we entered the room you could feel the smoke all over the sheets, curtains and pillows. there is no non smoker room i guess. even the common areas are smelly. the stuff smoke for 24 hours. cleanliness is an other issue. cant tell it was clean at all. breakfast was ok. actually it was more than I expected.location is a bit over the hill so u need to climb.rooms are tiny and shower is not well covered so water comes inside of the room. stuff is ok but cant speak english. in general if u r going to such a place u dont expect much. it could be a bit cleaner but its fine. ok for value of money u give.

Reviews.Title: “AFTER READING THE MOSTLY POSITIVE REVIEWS WE WEREN'T READY FOR THIS...”
Reviews.Author: Undefined
Reviews.Content: To premise this review I would like to say that my friend and I have extensively travelled the world on a right budget being early twenty year old students but even for the low price and good location we won't be back. As other reviewers have said the staff don't really speak English which although isn't their fault it is expected in order to own a "hotel". The breakfast also isn't flash but hey we still didn't really mind it was cheap an we are young! However the elevator is literally the size of a shoebox and hideously unsafe with NO DOOR! again we breathed in and relaxed and thought it's not that bad. The rooms are tiny, if one person wants to walk around the room the other must sit on the bed, literally as one reviewer said 2m by 2m. Again I thought it's cheap. It got worse, they only occasionally make up the rooms, we had it done once in 5 days, by day three we had no towels and no TOILET PAPER! trying to secure some required a complex and rather R18 version of charades due to the language barrier. But it got worse, they spend every night renovating until at least one am, jack hammers and nail guns on the floor we were on. To be honest I could go on all day, the truth is we are young and cheap and don't mind most things but the basics are missing here and the uneasy stares in the lobby even creeped me out a 24yr old guy. There are 3 nice places 100m away for exactly the same price, under 30 euro a night for two people. STAY THERE! this place is just not worth the stress and turmoil.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: illiari
Reviews.Content: Excelent location and value for money. Although the staff spoke very little English they were always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Pogopete
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone in the Medussa Hotel for three nights in September 2011 whilst sightseeing in Istanbul. I booked this hotel after reading positive feedback on this site. I paid Euro 60 per night for a single room with breakfast. The hotel is in an erxcellent centrally located location. You are 400 metres from the Sultanamet are which has all the historical sites. The Grand bazaar is 100 metres away. My room was simple but clean and the bed comfortable. I didn't find the staff to be as helpful as other reviewers but they did enough. Breakfast was, in my opinion, poor. I didn't bother after the first morning. If you want a cheap place to stay in the centre then this is fine. If you want more comfort and a better breakfast, go elsewhere and pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good points and bad. The room was very very small with the shower in the actual bathroom (no screen etc just part of the room) so everything got wet when you had a shower. In saying that the rooms were serviced daily with new towels etc and kept very clean. Breakfast is included but is an interesting array of food, not your standard 'breakfast'' - think olives, cheeses, boiled eggs, fresh vegetables - but all very nicely presented and very tasty. Generally the service we received was very good keeping in mind there was a language barrier. Just a couple of points for example the fridge in our room didnt work and although we mentioned this to the management on several occasions it was not fixed but really its not a major thing. Would stay here again but would hope for a bigger room as I think we ended up with the smallest of them all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel is "roughing it"”
Reviews.Author: lraff1
Reviews.Content: Super location 3 blocks from Grand Bazaar and walking distance to most other attractions. Rooms VERY cramped; bathroom with handheld shower that wets down the entire room; rooms not cleaned or beds made on a daily basis. Congenial and helpful management though. Elevator works sporadically.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped everywhere - In the rooms, toilets and lift!”
Reviews.Author: Samir_Sayad
Reviews.Content: To start with, there are good chances you could walk past the hotel without realizing the same! The hotel block is barely 4-5 meters wide and you can guess the room sizes. We had booked two rooms and were offered two 2m x 2m match boxes. Word of caution for ones with big or multiple suitcases, might have to step through them to reach your bed! Be prepared to have your bathrooms ankle length drenched while managing to bath. Well for transporting your luggage, you have an option of traveling single with a mid size suitcase or letting your bags travel while you run 3 to 4 floors up and collect them. Check-in was ok. The lone solace was our breakfast with views of the Marmara Sea. However, as realized later, the views are a common feature available in most of Sultanahmet hotels. There are plenty of better accommodation options within 2-5 mins walk; strongggggly suggest to seek elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel with wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Galinka_Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for 1 week and we had just a wonderful stay there. Though the room was small, but it was very tidy and we felt like we were at home:) nice and very friendly staff, every day cleaning, good terrace with wonderful sea view, good breakfast. Pick-up and transfer from/to airport were also organized very properly. If I go to Istanbul again I will stay in this Hotel only! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best location & best staff - a definite "Yes"”
Reviews.Author: hedgewog
Reviews.Content: So glad we stayed here - had a fabulous time. The room was small as was the bathroom with it's Turkish shower (no shower surround), however these were minor inconveniences weighed against the perfect location & fabulous staff. The day starts with a Turkish buffet breakfast on the top floor with a view of the Bosphorus. The area is also open during the day & evening to any guest wanting to enjoy some quiet time and the view. Watch out for the endless cups of Turkish tea you will be offered if you want to sleep at night! All major attractions are within a 5 minute walk, as is the metro and the ferry. Surrounded by restaurants of all price ranges and rug & china stores where charming proprietors try to entice you to view their wares. A great day is to buy a 1 way ticket on the 10:30 Bosphorus tour ferry at Eminonu (be there at 10:00). Get off at Saiyer and walk back thru town picking up some snacks on the way. Walk back along the river about 15 mins to Buyukdere for the Sadberk Hanim Museum (allow 2 hrs Thur - Tue). Then turn right & walk to the bus stop, catch 25E to Bebek and visit the Rumelihisari fortress (9:00 - 4:30 except Wed). Then catch the 25E again to Ortakoy. Get your stuffed potato and waffle and wander the streets. Continue on the 25E to Kabatas and then change to the metro to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SebaekOfCPH
Reviews.Content: A nice 3-star hotel for the budget minded. Friendly staff, who tries their best in a broken English. Small rooms, clean and relatively well kept. Breakfast offers the usual plus fresh fruit of the season, in our case strawberries en masse. Unic selling point is the roof top terrace with a view over the Bosperous, where the breakfast is served. Turkey has introduced a no smoking policy in public rooms, whereas all rooms and other inside areas are non smoking.

Reviews.Title: “A good camp to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Polpi_viaggiatori
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent to visit Sultanahmet (but Beyoglu is more strategic for night life). One of the things that we liked most was breakfast from the rooftop with its beautiful view. Staff were kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No reservation, despite a confirmed booking”
Reviews.Author: Hawkinsian
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at the Meddusa a month before our stay in Istanbul. When we arrived (armed with all our print outs of the confirmed booking), we were given a shake of the head as the hotel was full. It was difficult to understand what the problem was as the hotel person didn't speak very much English and I can't speak Turkish (I don't blame the hotel for my lack of Turkish!). We were eventually helped with our bags to another hotel nearby (Hotel Aquarium) and this place was very disappointing. I can't leave any feedback about Meddusa Hotel as a place to stay but as a place to make bookings with, our experience has been very poor. I would recommend that any 'confirmed' online bookings are checked and double checked before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Small, simple Hotel close to major sights”
Reviews.Author: Sylvester_Shoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Meddusa Hotel in Istanbul for four nights in October 2010 for a leisure trip. People at the reception were friendly. Communication in English was possible but do not expect too much. The double room was tiny. Sometimes it was easier to crawl over the bed than to pass each other in the scarce space between bed, walls and furniture where our luggage was placed. The bed was not too big but good enough. The mattress was alright. After walking the city we had a good sleep. The bathroom was small too, but clean and in an acceptable condition. Our room on the 2nd floor led to the street which can be a little noisy (in the morning). You might want to ask for a room which leads to the back of the building. Still, there are mosques around which call for prayer early in the morning. The Hotel is placed in Sultanahmet which is a quarter of the city with some of the major sights. You can easily walk to the Hagia Sophia, the Grand Basar, the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet). A walk to the Galata-Brigde which is kind of the centre of the centre takes about 15 minutes. Walking to the Galata-Tower and inn-quarter Beyoglu takes further 15 to 25 minutes. One of the tram lines which takes you to the Galata bridge and further is not too far. In close distance to the Meddusa Hotel are small shops, cafes, restaurants, a supermarket... All in all Meddusa Hotel was alright. It seemed to me that the price for value relation was okay. I can recommend it but do not expect too much. Ask for a room that does not lead to the street. However, you might want to carry ear plugs. Just in case.

Reviews.Title: “No rooms left in the hotel when we arrived!”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateDenise
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight at the hotel only to be told we had no room, complete with a 3 and 8 year old.They apparently were full up. They had "checked" my credit card the day before and said it had not worked (never not worked before and it worked perfectly at several locations in istanbul the time we were there).They did not send an email or try to contact me to say they would be giving our room away.However they did find us another room in another hotel.This was a tiny room with 2 single beds.Not very good for 2 adults and 2 children(hardly slept) Not in the same place either.The staff were friendly and appologised but if my husband hadn`t been turkish i don`t know what we would have done as the staff on the night of our arrival spoke turkish only.When it came to paying (The full price) my credit card did not work in their machine so we had to pay in turkish lira which worked out more expensive.Read reviews before we set of and lots of people complained that the credit card machine had not worked.My advice is double check the day before you go that your room is still availiable and take erous to pay them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A_Traveller27
Reviews.Content: Good Points: Fantastic location - can walk everywhere within 5 mins Cheap - we paid about 40-50euro per room per night Nice/helpful staff Nice breakfast terrace (simple breakfast - bread etc) Bad points: Shower was over sink/toilet -wet floor - bathroom v small No window in our room but others had windows Room was v small - had to shuffle around bed Could smell smoke sometimes even though it was non-smoking room BUT overall, if you're not bothered by the points above and you just plan to sleep there it's great! Not for a luxury romantic honeymoon but definitely worth it for a budget city break. TIP! Only pay 20 lira for the shuttle to Sabiha Gokcen airport and don't buy anything at the Grand Bizarre, it's a total ripoff - can buy exactly the same thing at little shops around Istanbul so shop around first!!

Reviews.Title: “exelent location”
Reviews.Author: nihat_10
Reviews.Content: exelent location and very nice wiew.room was small but staff was very helpfull....................................................

Reviews.Title: “Good value, walk anywhere, ask anything.”
Reviews.Author: sapphiremcphee
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff here really helped a single traveler make the best of a relatively unplanned one-week trip to Istanbul. Nihat, the concierge / excellent coffe maker / source of information on anything in Istanbul ...he made all the difference. The hotel itself has small rooms, but they're only for sleeping in really, until the next morning when you astart out again. Small...but very clean. A simple but substantial breakfast is available in the small eating area on the fourth (top) floor: eggs, sliced meat, fruit, dry cereal. Olives, of course. And the best coffee! You can sit outside on the small balcony and have a fabulous view of the city or just watch the world go by below. Buhara Restaurant, next door, was wonderful as well. Very tasty food at reasonable prices...sit outside on the sidewalk if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Just fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: eleanastella
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the staff who work in this amazing hotel. Guys - you are great! The location is superb in the old city of Sultanahmet. The hotel is small and cozy with a family atmosphere. It's very, very clean - thanks to a cleaning lady - she does so much, i could never expect such services from a 2 star hotel! Great! The rooms have all the facilities that you can expect from a 4 star hotel - new furniture, good repairment, a hairdyer, a TV, a fridge which is like a mini-bar, the towels are changed every day, you can have breakfast which is included in the price on a wonderful terrace with Bosphorus view. They serve a typical turkish breakfast which consists of olives, cheese, vegetables, butter, jam, yoghurt, cereal, juice, tea and instant coffee ( that's the only minus i can think about). And all this you get for a very reasonable price. Isn't that enough for choosing this hotel in Istanbul? Everybody at the reception speaks English. Thanks again for a pleasant stay to everybody who works at this place - and especially Deniz! See you again in May!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staffs and best location”
Reviews.Author: Sandy2010Berlin
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul with my family for 7 day and stayed at the Meddusa Hotel. We were in the family room which was basic, not big, but always very clean. The breakfast was correct. We got recommandation from our friend in Paris who stayed also in the same hotel with his family. The hotel is situated in a nice small street, about 5 minutes walk to Topcapi palast and Hagia Sophia, it also has a wonderful view of the Bospherous sea via the terrace. What we like the most was the friendly family atmosphere and the warm attitude of the staffs. I have booked the hotel via telephone and email via Deniz, who was always very friendly and helpful. As we arrived at the AtatÃ¼rk airport, we were waited as the hotel would offer the free airport transport service. It is very nice when you arrive at a strange place and you are waited by someone you know you can follow... And we would like to take this oppurtunity to thank Nihad for making us feel particularly welcome and for his always friendly help towards us and our kids. The cleaning woman smiles littel, but she did great job for making us feel good in a nicely arranged clean room. We warmly recommand you this hotel. Zhenhua, Germany

Reviews.Title: “It's a amazing experince for me to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Siddiqui1977
Reviews.Content: It's a amazing experince for me to stay at meddusa hotel service excellent and location perfect all historical places on walking distance,and I strongly recommend this hotel for your best trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ocarina67
Reviews.Content: Absolutly wonderful! I strongly recommend this hotel! The service is perfect. The staff is very kind and professionnal. We have an amazing journey in this hotel. Thank you so much! =)

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: vlovlovlo
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel at all. The staff is very nice, smily and effective.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for that money ....”
Reviews.Author: Lekki_1065
Reviews.Content: Meddusa Hotel - Istanbul centre - Oct 07-Oct 11, 2009. Actually the hotel is not bad for 40Euro in peak season. The worst part is the shower - no curtain no tub - so when you have the shower - everything around is wet including towels and toilet paper. The stuff is rather helpful. The breakfast is very simple: bread, chease, tomatoes, eggs (boiled and fried), jam, grapes, tea, coffee. What else do we need? The open terrace view is terrific. These is a nice restourant next door, just a good place to have you evening beer and kebab. So, if you come to Istanbul just for sightseeing to catch the last simmer days - Meddusa hotel is not bad choice, just not expect too much! Oh, they do love CASH, so they pretend as if their card terminal doesn't operational, be ready and do not check out at last moment when your taxi is waiting for you. But for me, Istanbul is too crouded, too crouded in early October. I like to visit it before Christmas and next time will come here this time of the year. Enjoy Istanbul, it is beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “I could never imagine a worse hotel.”
Reviews.Author: laperche
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the website that is posted for this hotel is not this hotel. I showed up with a group, ready to check into the hotel that I had seen online, and was confronted by a shabby hotel with threadbare carpet, tiny smoky rooms, windows that did not open, and worse, body hair on the sheets of the beds. The towels were gray. My students checked their rooms and reported the same experience. We all slept on top of the covers with our clothes on. (We couldn't go someplace else because of the lateness of the hour and because we were exhausted from all day travel to Istanbul.) The breakfast was adequate. The staff were friendly, but the hotel was simply one of the worst that I have ever stayed in. A student with asthma was sick in the morning from the smoke in the room, and we were all disgusted by the hair throughout our rooms. Never book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loud noisy clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: powderbud
Reviews.Content: We were transferred from the nice Venus hotel to the Meddusa hotel. The walls were paper thin and the party upstairs keeped us awake until 2:30 am. The second night was a little better however you could hear movement around the hotel all night long. the rooms were simple and clean. We preferred the Venus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shropshire44
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean, beds very comfortable - easy walking distance to top sites/restaurants/shopping, etc. Small roof terrace with wonderful views of Bosphorus where you can have a great breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. Excellent 2 Star hotel. Chris and Veronica

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Preference”
Reviews.Author: BTLim
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Meddusa for only 1 night in October 2009. There is nothing to complain about this hotel. Hotels in istanbul is overpriced and if you are looking for a nice and cozy sleep in a budget with own ensuite, then this is the one . This small hotel is just 5 minutes walk from Sultanahmet tram stop, although you need to do a bit of searching before you can locate it. The stairs leading to the hotel is a bit doggy, a small reception area and an even smaller room . Our twin room on the third floor is very small but clean , just have enough room to manuvoure and the bathroom is even worst, hardly any room even for Asians. But if you are looking to stay Sultanahmet area and don't want to pay more then this is the choice. The owner, Deniz is very friendly and breakfast was served on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus with hotly cook omellete. A plus in Turkey. Very close to everything and a 5 minutes walk from tram station is a plus if you are on bacpacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Whidbeypix
Reviews.Content: I had a quite satisfactory week-long stay at the Meddusa. The place is a bit threadbare and my room (first floor on street side) was not as quiet as I'd have liked. But great location, friendly staff (not great English skills), clean (but a bit threadbare) room. Breakfast never changes but includes cornflakes as well as the usual yogurt/cheese/bread/cukes/tomatoes/olives/tea/instant coffee/juices. Terrace view is not the best but lets you survey the day's weather. Plenty of free drinks stocked in the refrigerator. Wifi worked well in my room. I was able to use my T-Mobile phone to make free US calls via wifi. Starbuck's and several nice sidewalk cafes are a block away on the pedestrian mall part of the street, just before the Mosque courtyard that leads to the covered bazaar (three blocks from hotel). Aya Sofia and tram stop are about four blocks away. I paid E308 ($460) for a week in October '09, and feel that it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again or recommend to friends ? No”
Reviews.Author: PatSE4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of price and other good comments. I did not have a good experience. On arrival in spite of having paid up front a month in advance I was told there was no room avavilable for me so I was taken to a supposedly same standard hotel around the corner. It was not the same standard and i turned down all the three rooms I was offered. Returning to the Meddusa i was told to come back in an hour and spent an anxious time wondering where i was going to stay. On my return I was given room 101. This room had no view apart from the yard of the next door building. There was intermittent noise from some sort of ventilation system. There was no way of turning on the remote control. I asked and was eventually given a remote control. When you opened the door to the landing you were immediately hit by the smell of smoke from the lobby. On the plus side the location is excellent and the room clean. the view from the roof terrace was good., and the breakfast adequate. i did not find the staff friendly and in fact found them quite intimidating. I would not book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: tripchoya
Reviews.Content: A lovely location for a short stay in Istanbul. It's not on a slope, so that's a big plus. Deniz is very kind and friendly. Breakfast is on the terrace and there's instant tea available. I also liked the yogurt with honey available every morning. The slightly down point is that the room can be a little small. And the only chair we had in the room had 3 legs, so it was wobbly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bicba
Reviews.Content: If you look for a cozy, low budget hotel, Meddusa is the right place for you. The rooms are not very big but very clean with fresh towels every day. The place is very near to all the main sights in Sultanahmet, no need to use the public transport. Staff was very friendly, willing to help in every situation, so we wish to thank them for the pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Free Wi-Fi and Clean to boot”
Reviews.Author: kilgoretroutBoston
Reviews.Content: I have never done a review and I went through the rigmarole of signing up just to get the word out for this place. The staff was so friendly and accomodating that I want to return all they did for for me and give them the great review they deserve. The free breakfast was substantial and they served free coffee or tea all day and night on their upstairs patio with a great view. There was free Wi-Fi in the room that always had a great connection. Safety and cleanliness were never in question.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Inwardtraveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul witn my family for 10 day and stayed at the Meddusa Hotel. We were in the family room which was very clean,tidy and spacious. The hotel also has a sectacular view of the Goldon Horn and the Bospherous sea. The staff were very helpful and showed great kindness to my children. Meddusa is 2 minutes away from the local supermarket and a number of small restaurants. It's also about 10 mins away from the major tourist attractions in the Sultan Ahmet area. What I like best about the hotel was the friendly family atmosphere and the warm attitude of the staff. I would like to take this oppurtunity to thank Samir for making us feel particularly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Mel_004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay for the price. The location is perfect, everything is reachable in 5 minutes. Rooms are clean and big enough. The staff is nice and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Meddusa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nuruosmaniye Cad. No/7 Sultanahmet | Cagaloglu, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
